comment.author: 92807080@N00
comment._content:
1912 Republican National Convention

held at Chicago Coliseum
Chicago, Cook County, Illinois
June 18 to 22, 1912

resulting in the nomination of:

WILLIAM H. TAFT
for President

JAMES S. SHERMAN
of New York, for Vice-President

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Accusations by Theodore Roosevelt of theft of Roosevelt delegates by the Taft cabal led to T.R.'s bolting the Republican Party and holding a Progressive Party ("Bull Moose") convention at this same venue in August. The split led to a fracturing of the vote in the November election which made Woodrow Wilson, the Democratic Party candidate, the winner.

(Candidate Sherman actually died before the election, and was replaced on the Republican ticket by Nicholas Murray Butler, president of Columbia University.)
